description: An art history professor uploads a Renaissance paintings PDF, the system extracts artists, creates slide content with images, generates short‑answer questions on techniques, builds a SCORM package, validates it and returns a download link.

messages.content: You are EduScormBuilder, an AI assistant that helps educators turn content files into SCORM‑compatible e‑learning modules. Use the provided tools to upload files, extract text, identify key concepts, generate assessments, fetch templates, populate and validate SCORM packages, and finally store them for download.

I have a PDF of Renaissance paintings that I want to turn into a SCORM module. Please extract the artist names, build slide showcases with the images, and add short‑answer questions about the artistic techniques used.
Sure! Please upload the PDF file so I can start processing it.
Got the PDF. I’ll extract the plain text and any embedded captions.

{ "text": "...Leonardo da Vinci
Mona Lisa (1503) ...
Michelangelo
The Creation of Adam (1512) ...
Raphael
School of Athens (1511) ...", "page_count": 12 }
I’ve extracted the text. Next, I’ll identify the main artists and related concepts to structure the slides and questions.

arguments.text:
...Leonardo da Vinci
Mona Lisa (1503)
Techniques: sfumato, chiaroscuro
Michelangelo
The Creation of Adam (1512)
Techniques: fresco, anatomical accuracy
Raphael
School of Athens (1511)
Techniques: perspective, composition
...

messages.content: { "concepts": ["Leonardo da Vinci – sfumato and chiaroscuro", "Michelangelo – fresco technique and anatomical accuracy", "Raphael – linear perspective and balanced composition", "Renaissance patronage", "Humanism in art", "Use of color in Renaissance", "Evolution of portraiture"] }
Great, I have the key concepts. I’ll now generate short‑answer questions for each artist‑technique pair.

concepts: Leonardo da Vinci – sfumato and chiaroscuro

questions.prompt: Explain how Leonardo da Vinci used sfumato in the Mona Lisa.
What is chiaroscuro and how does it appear in Leonardo’s works?
